title.narrative: Technical Assistance - Mrida Intelligent Transportation System Modernization, through Enterprise - United States Unknown

description.narrative: The objective of the Mrida ITS Modernization Technical Assistance in Mexico is to support the deployment of Intelligent Transportation System (ITS) technologies, to modernize the bus control and monitoring center, and to advance the transition to electric buses for the public transportation fleet in Mrida, the capital of the State of Yucatn. The technical assistance would support Instituto de Movilidad y Desarrollo Urbano Territorial (IMDUT)'s Integrated Transport System Project by providing recommendations for the selection of ITS and electric mobility solutions to modernize Mrida's public transportation system.

description.narrative: USTDA is providing a $640,500 technical assistance grant to Mexico's Comisin Federal de Electricidad (CFE) to strengthen environmental management at the power plants, substations, and power transmission and distribution facilities operated by the company. title.narrative: NAICM Green Airport Program, through Arup Group Limited

description.narrative: USTDA's grant will fund technical assistance to develop a Green Airport Program for the new Mexico City International Airport. Mexico City's new airport is expected to become the largest airport in Latin America and on of the busiest airports in the world. The Green Airport Program will help the airport concession holder, Grupo Aeroportunario de la Ciudad de Mxico, S.A. de C.V., to adopt international best practices related to green airport construction and operations by using renewable energy resources, promoting the use of public transport, and developing programs that would protect the environment, including water resources, wildlife, and vegetation.

title.narrative: Feasibility Study - Baja California Wind Power Project, through Government of Mexico

description.narrative: This $374,000 feasibility study grant for the Baja California Wind PPA Project helps the State Government of Baja California to design a 100 MW wind power generation project to supply renewable power to state government office buildings and facilities. The Baja California Wind PPA Project supports the Energy and Climate Change Partnership of the Americas, the U.S.-Mexico Bilateral Framework on Clean Energy and Climate Change, and Mexico's National Infrastructure Program.
